text: Melissa Victoria Harris-Perry (born October 2, 1973) is an American television host and writer. She hosts a television programme on MSNBC called Melissa Harris-Perry. ==Life and career== She got a Ph.D. in political science from Duke University in 1999. That year she married Dennis Lacewell. She divorced him in 2005. She is a professor of political science at Tulane University. In 2004, her first book Barbershops, Bibles, and BET: Everyday Talk and Black Political Thought was published. In 2011, Yale Press published Perry's book Sister Citizen: Shame, Stereotypes, and Black Women in America. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1973 births Category:African- American writers Category:Living people Category:American television presenters Category:Academics from Louisiana
